pageContext.claim: “Supreme Court rules in favor of non-union workers who are now, as an example, able to support a candidate of his or her choice without having those who control the Union deciding for them. Big loss for the coffers of the Democrats!”
pageContext.analysis: Nothing prevented non-union workers from supporting candidates of their choice. The Supreme Court in Janus v. AFSCME actually ruled that states could not force public employees to pay union fees.
